00031 
00032 #define MIN_DATE                (-657434L)  // about year 100
00033 #define MAX_DATE                2958465L    // about year 9999
00034 
00035 // Half a second, expressed in days
00036 #define HALF_SECOND  (1.0/172800.0)
00037 
00038 // One-based array of days in year at month start
00039 static int rgMonthDays[13] =
00040         {0, 31, 59, 90, 120, 151, 181, 212, 243, 273, 304, 334, 365};
00041 
00042 AffxTime::AffxTime()
00043         {empty();}
00044 
00045 AffxTime::AffxTime(const AffxTime& timeSrc)
00046         { m_time = timeSrc.m_time;}
00047 
00048 AffxTimeSpan::AffxTimeSpan()
00049         { }
00050 
00052 // AffxTime - absolute time
00053 
00054 AffxTime::AffxTime(time_t time)
00055 {
00056         double dtSrc = (double)time / 24.0 / 60.0 / 60.0;
00057         
00058         tm tm;
00059         memset((void*)&tm, 0, sizeof(tm)); tm.tm_isdst = -1;
00060 
00061         // The legal range does not actually span year 0 to 9999.
00062         if (dtSrc > MAX_DATE || dtSrc < MIN_DATE) // about year 100 to about 9999
00063                 return;
00064 
00065         int nDays;             // Number of days since Dec. 30, 1899
00066         int nDaysAbsolute;     // Number of days since 1/1/0
00067         int nSecsInDay;        // Time in seconds since midnight
00068         int nMinutesInDay;     // Minutes in day
00069 
00070         int n400Years;         // Number of 400 year increments since 1/1/0
00071         int n400Century;       // Century within 400 year block (0,1,2 or 3)
00072         int n4Years;           // Number of 4 year increments since 1/1/0
00073         int n4Day;             // Day within 4 year block
00074                                                         //  (0 is 1/1/yr1, 1460 is 12/31/yr4)
00075         int n4Yr;              // Year within 4 year block (0,1,2 or 3)
00076         bool bLeap4 = true;     // TRUE if 4 year block includes leap year
00077 
00078         double dblDate = dtSrc; // tempory serial date
00079 
00080         // If a valid date, then this conversion should not overflow
00081         nDays = (int)dblDate;
00082 
00083         // Round to the second
00084         dblDate += ((dtSrc > 0.0) ? HALF_SECOND : -HALF_SECOND);
00085 
00086         nDaysAbsolute = (int)dblDate + 693959L; // Add days from 1/1/0 to 12/30/1899
00087 
00088         dblDate = fabs(dblDate);
00089         nSecsInDay = (int)((dblDate - floor(dblDate)) * 86400.);
00090 
00091         // Calculate the day of week (sun=1, mon=2...)
00092         //   -1 because 1/1/0 is Sat.  +1 because we want 1-based
00093         tm.tm_wday = (int)((nDaysAbsolute - 1) % 7L) + 1;
00094 
00095         // Leap years every 4 yrs except centuries not multiples of 400.
00096         n400Years = (int)(nDaysAbsolute / 146097L);
00097 
00098         // Set nDaysAbsolute to day within 400-year block
00099         nDaysAbsolute %= 146097L;
00100 
00101         // -1 because first century has extra day
00102         n400Century = (int)((nDaysAbsolute - 1) / 36524L);
00103 
00104         // Non-leap century
00105         if (n400Century != 0)
00106         {
00107                 // Set nDaysAbsolute to day within century
00108                 nDaysAbsolute = (nDaysAbsolute - 1) % 36524L;
00109 
00110                 // +1 because 1st 4 year increment has 1460 days
00111                 n4Years = (int)((nDaysAbsolute + 1) / 1461L);
00112 
00113                 if (n4Years != 0)
00114                         n4Day = (int)((nDaysAbsolute + 1) % 1461L);
00115                 else
00116                 {
00117                         bLeap4 = false;
00118                         n4Day = (int)nDaysAbsolute;
00119                 }
00120         }
00121         else
00122         {
00123                 // Leap century - not special case!
00124                 n4Years = (int)(nDaysAbsolute / 1461L);
00125                 n4Day = (int)(nDaysAbsolute % 1461L);
00126         }
00127 
00128         if (bLeap4)
00129         {
00130                 // -1 because first year has 366 days
00131                 n4Yr = (n4Day - 1) / 365;
00132 
00133                 if (n4Yr != 0)
00134                         n4Day = (n4Day - 1) % 365;
00135         }
00136         else
00137         {
00138                 n4Yr = n4Day / 365;
00139                 n4Day %= 365;
00140         }
00141 
00142         // n4Day is now 0-based day of year. Save 1-based day of year, year number
00143         tm.tm_yday = (int)n4Day + 1;
00144         tm.tm_year = n400Years * 400 + n400Century * 100 + n4Years * 4 + n4Yr;
00145 
00146         // Handle leap year: before, on, and after Feb. 29.
00147         if (n4Yr == 0 && bLeap4)
00148         {
00149                 // Leap Year
00150                 if (n4Day == 59)
00151                 {
00152                         /* Feb. 29 */
00153                         tm.tm_mon = 2;
00154                         tm.tm_mday = 29;
00155                         goto DoTime;
00156                 }
00157 
00158                 // Pretend it's not a leap year for month/day comp.
00159                 if (n4Day >= 60)
00160                         --n4Day;
00161         }
00162 
00163         // Make n4DaY a 1-based day of non-leap year and compute
00164         //  month/day for everything but Feb. 29.
00165         ++n4Day;
00166 
00167         // Month number always >= n/32, so save some loop time */
00168         for (tm.tm_mon = (n4Day >> 5) + 1;
00169                 n4Day > rgMonthDays[tm.tm_mon]; tm.tm_mon++);
00170 
00171         tm.tm_mday = (int)(n4Day - rgMonthDays[tm.tm_mon-1]);
00172 
00173 DoTime:
00174         if (nSecsInDay == 0)
00175                 tm.tm_hour = tm.tm_min = tm.tm_sec = 0;
00176         else
00177         {
00178                 tm.tm_sec = (int)nSecsInDay % 60L;
00179                 nMinutesInDay = nSecsInDay / 60L;
00180                 tm.tm_min = (int)nMinutesInDay % 60;
00181                 tm.tm_hour = (int)nMinutesInDay / 60;
00182         }
00183 
00184         m_time = tm;
00185 }
00186 AffxTime::AffxTime(int nYear, int nMonth, int nDay, int nHour, int nMin, int nSec, int nDST)
00187 {
00188         struct tm atm;
00189         memset((void*)&atm, 0, sizeof(tm)); atm.tm_isdst = -1;
00190         atm.tm_sec = nSec;
00191         atm.tm_min = nMin;
00192         atm.tm_hour = nHour;
00193         if (nDay < 1 && nDay > 31) {Err::errAbort("AffxTime, invalid day value.");}
00194         atm.tm_mday = nDay;
00195 //      _ASSERTE(nMonth >= 1 && nMonth <= 12);
00196         atm.tm_mon = nMonth;  
00197         atm.tm_year = nYear;  
00198         atm.tm_isdst = nDST;
00199 
00200         m_time = atm;
00201 
00202 //      _ASSERTE(m_time != -1);       // indicates an illegal input time
00203 }
00204 
00205 AffxTime AffxTime::getCurrentTime()
00206 // return the current system time
00207 {
00208         AffxTime time;
00209         tm tm;
00210         
00211         time_t lTime = ::time(NULL);
00212         tm = *localtime(&lTime);
00213         time.m_time = tm; 
00214         // Do not free(ptm) as subsequent calls to this function will then fail.
00215         
00216         time.m_time.tm_mon++;
00217         if (time.m_time.tm_year < 50)
00218                 time.m_time.tm_year = time.m_time.tm_year + 2000;
00219         else if (time.m_time.tm_year < 100)
00220                 time.m_time.tm_year = time.m_time.tm_year + 1900;
00221         else if (time.m_time.tm_year > 100)
00222                 time.m_time.tm_year = time.m_time.tm_year -100 + 2000;
00223 
00224 
00225         return time;
00226 }

00235 // String formatting
00236 
00237 #define maxTimeBufferSize       128
00238         // Verifies will fail if the needed buffer size is too large
00239 
00240 AffxString AffxTimeSpan::format(char* pFormat) const
00241 // formatting timespans is a little trickier than formatting AffxTimes
00242 //  * we are only interested in relative time formats, ie. it is illegal
00243 //      to format anything dealing with absolute time (i.e. years, months,
00244 //         day of week, day of year, timezones, ...)
00245 //  * the only valid formats:
00246 //      %D - # of days -- NEW !!!
00247 //      %H - hour in 24 hour format
00248 //      %M - minute (0-59)
00249 //      %S - seconds (0-59)
00250 //      %% - percent sign
00251 {
00252         char szBuffer[maxTimeBufferSize];
00253         char ch;
00254         char* pch = szBuffer;
00255 
00256         while ((ch = *pFormat++) != '\0')
00257         {
00258                 if (ch == '%')
00259                 {
00260                         switch (ch = *pFormat++)
00261                         {
00262                         default:
00263                                 Err::errAbort("AffxTimeSpan, Bad format character.");      // probably a bad format character
00264                         case '%':
00265                                 *pch++ = ch;
00266                                 break;
00267                         case 'D':
00268                                 pch += sprintf(pch, "%d", getDays());
00269                                 break;
00270                         case 'H':
00271                                 pch += sprintf(pch, "%02d", getHours());
00272                                 break;
00273                         case 'M':
00274                                 pch += sprintf(pch, "%02d", getMinutes());
00275                                 break;
00276                         case 'S':
00277                                 pch += sprintf(pch, "%02d", getSeconds());
00278                                 break;
00279                         }
00280                 }
00281                 else
00282                 {
00283                         *pch++ = ch;
00284                 }
00285         }
00286 
00287         *pch = '\0';
00288         return szBuffer;
00289 }
00290 
00291 void AffxTime::empty()
00292 {
00293         struct tm atm;
00294         memset((void*)&atm, 0, sizeof(tm)); atm.tm_isdst = -1;
00295         m_time = atm;
00296 }
00297 
00298 void AffxTimeSpan::empty()
00299 {
00300         m_timeSpan = 0;
00301 }
00302 
00303 // Calculate the DATE value.
00304 AffxTimeSpan::AffxTimeSpan(double dt)
00305 {
00306         // Convert from days to total seconds.
00307         m_timeSpan = (int)(dt * 24 * 60 * 60);
00308 }
00309 
00310 // Calculate the DATE value.
00311 double AffxTimeSpan::getDATE(void)
00312 {
00313         double dt = 0;
00314 
00315         int lDays = getDays();
00316         int nHours = getHours();
00317         int nMinutes = getMinutes();
00318         int nSeconds = getSeconds();
00319 
00320         // Set date span by breaking into fractional days (all input ranges valid)
00321         dt = lDays + ((double)nHours)/24 + ((double)nMinutes)/(24*60) +
00322                 ((double)nSeconds)/(24*60*60);
00323 
00324         return dt;
00325 }
00326 
00327 // Calculate the DATE value.
00328 double AffxTime::getDATE(void)
00329 {
00330         double dt = 0;
00331 
00332         int wYear = getYear();
00333         int wMonth = getMonth();
00334         int wDay = getDay();
00335         int wHour = getHour();
00336         int wMinute = getMinute();
00337         int wSecond = getSecond();
00338 
00339         // Validate year and month (ignore day of week and milliseconds)
00340         if (wYear > 9999 || wMonth < 1 || wMonth > 12)
00341                 return 0;
00342 
00343         //  Check for leap year and set the number of days in the month
00344         bool bLeapYear = ((wYear & 3) == 0) &&
00345                 ((wYear % 100) != 0 || (wYear % 400) == 0);
00346 
00347         int nDaysInMonth =
00348                 rgMonthDays[wMonth] - rgMonthDays[wMonth-1] +
00349                 ((bLeapYear && wDay == 29 && wMonth == 2) ? 1 : 0);
00350 
00351         // Finish validating the date
00352         if (wDay < 1 || wDay > nDaysInMonth ||
00353                 wHour > 23 || wMinute > 59 ||
00354                 wSecond > 59)
00355         {
00356                 return 0;
00357         }
00358 
00359         // Cache the date in days and time in fractional days
00360         int nDate;
00361         double dblTime;
00362 
00363         //It is a valid date; make Jan 1, 1AD be 1
00364         nDate = wYear*365L + wYear/4 - wYear/100 + wYear/400 +
00365                 rgMonthDays[wMonth-1] + wDay;
00366 
00367         //  If leap year and it's before March, subtract 1:
00368         if (wMonth <= 2 && bLeapYear)
00369                 --nDate;
00370 
00371         //  Offset so that 12/30/1899 is 0
00372         nDate -= 693959L;
00373 
00374         dblTime = (((int)wHour * 3600L) +  // hrs in seconds
00375                 ((int)wMinute * 60L) +  // mins in seconds
00376                 ((int)wSecond)) / 86400.;
00377 
00378         dt = (double) nDate + ((nDate >= 0) ? dblTime : -dblTime);
00379 
00380         return dt;
00381 }
00382 
00383 // Constructor for DATE.
00384 AffxTime::AffxTime(double dtSrc)
00385 {
00386         tm tm;  
00387         memset((void*)&tm, 0, sizeof(tm)); tm.tm_isdst = -1;
00388 
00389         // The legal range does not actually span year 0 to 9999.
00390         if (dtSrc > MAX_DATE || dtSrc < MIN_DATE) // about year 100 to about 9999
00391                 return;
00392

00394         int nDaysAbsolute;     // Number of days since 1/1/0
00395         int nSecsInDay;        // Time in seconds since midnight
00396         int nMinutesInDay;     // Minutes in day
00397

00399         int n400Century;       // Century within 400 year block (0,1,2 or 3)
00400         int n4Years;           // Number of 4 year increments since 1/1/0
00401         int n4Day;             // Day within 4 year block
00402                                                         //  (0 is 1/1/yr1, 1460 is 12/31/yr4)
00403         int n4Yr;              // Year within 4 year block (0,1,2 or 3)
00404         bool bLeap4 = true;     // TRUE if 4 year block includes leap year
00405 
00406         double dblDate = dtSrc; // tempory serial date
00407 
00408         // If a valid date, then this conversion should not overflow
00409         nDays = (int)dblDate;
00410 
00411         // Round to the second
00412         dblDate += ((dtSrc > 0.0) ? HALF_SECOND : -HALF_SECOND);
00413 
00414         nDaysAbsolute = (int)dblDate + 693959L; // Add days from 1/1/0 to 12/30/1899
00415 
00416         dblDate = fabs(dblDate);
00417         nSecsInDay = (int)((dblDate - floor(dblDate)) * 86400.);
00418 
00419         // Calculate the day of week (sun=1, mon=2...)
00420         //   -1 because 1/1/0 is Sat.  +1 because we want 1-based
00421         tm.tm_wday = (int)((nDaysAbsolute - 1) % 7L) + 1;
00422 
00423         // Leap years every 4 yrs except centuries not multiples of 400.
00424         n400Years = (int)(nDaysAbsolute / 146097L);
00425 
00426         // Set nDaysAbsolute to day within 400-year block
00427         nDaysAbsolute %= 146097L;
00428 
00429         // -1 because first century has extra day
00430         n400Century = (int)((nDaysAbsolute - 1) / 36524L);
00431 
00432         // Non-leap century
00433         if (n400Century != 0)
00434         {
00435                 // Set nDaysAbsolute to day within century
00436                 nDaysAbsolute = (nDaysAbsolute - 1) % 36524L;
00437 
00438                 // +1 because 1st 4 year increment has 1460 days
00439                 n4Years = (int)((nDaysAbsolute + 1) / 1461L);
00440 
00441                 if (n4Years != 0)
00442                         n4Day = (int)((nDaysAbsolute + 1) % 1461L);
00443                 else
00444                 {
00445                         bLeap4 = false;
00446                         n4Day = (int)nDaysAbsolute;
00447                 }
00448         }
00449         else
00450         {
00451                 // Leap century - not special case!
00452                 n4Years = (int)(nDaysAbsolute / 1461L);
00453                 n4Day = (int)(nDaysAbsolute % 1461L);
00454         }
00455 
00456         if (bLeap4)
00457         {
00458                 // -1 because first year has 366 days
00459                 n4Yr = (n4Day - 1) / 365;
00460 
00461                 if (n4Yr != 0)
00462                         n4Day = (n4Day - 1) % 365;
00463         }
00464         else
00465         {
00466                 n4Yr = n4Day / 365;
00467                 n4Day %= 365;
00468         }
00469 
00470         // n4Day is now 0-based day of year. Save 1-based day of year, year number
00471         tm.tm_yday = (int)n4Day + 1;
00472         tm.tm_year = n400Years * 400 + n400Century * 100 + n4Years * 4 + n4Yr;
00473 
00474         // Handle leap year: before, on, and after Feb. 29.
00475         if (n4Yr == 0 && bLeap4)
00476         {
00477                 // Leap Year
00478                 if (n4Day == 59)
00479                 {
00480                         /* Feb. 29 */
00481                         tm.tm_mon = 2;
00482                         tm.tm_mday = 29;
00483                         goto DoTime;
00484                 }
00485 
00486                 // Pretend it's not a leap year for month/day comp.
00487                 if (n4Day >= 60)
00488                         --n4Day;
00489         }
00490 
00491         // Make n4DaY a 1-based day of non-leap year and compute
00492         //  month/day for everything but Feb. 29.
00493         ++n4Day;
00494 
00495         // Month number always >= n/32, so save some loop time */
00496         for (tm.tm_mon = (n4Day >> 5) + 1;
00497                 n4Day > rgMonthDays[tm.tm_mon]; tm.tm_mon++);
00498 
00499         tm.tm_mday = (int)(n4Day - rgMonthDays[tm.tm_mon-1]);
00500 
00501 DoTime:
00502         if (nSecsInDay == 0)
00503                 tm.tm_hour = tm.tm_min = tm.tm_sec = 0;
00504         else
00505         {
00506                 tm.tm_sec = (int)nSecsInDay % 60L;
00507                 nMinutesInDay = nSecsInDay / 60L;
00508                 tm.tm_min = (int)nMinutesInDay % 60;
00509                 tm.tm_hour = (int)nMinutesInDay / 60;
00510         }
00511 
00512         m_time = tm;
00513 }
00514 
00515 // Format the date into a string.    
00516 AffxString AffxTime::getTimeStampString(void)
00517 {
00518         AffxString str;
00519 
00520         if (!isEmpty())
00521         {
00522                 int iMonth = getMonth();
00523                 int iDay = getDay();
00524                 int iYear = getYear();
00525                 int iHour = getHour();
00526                 int iMinute = getMinute();
00527                 int iSecond = getSecond();
00528 
00529                 char szBuffer[64];
00530                 sprintf(szBuffer, "%02d/%02d/%d %02d:%02d:%02d", iMonth, iDay, iYear, iHour, iMinute, iSecond);
00531                 str = szBuffer;
00532         }
00533 
00534         return str;
00535 }
00536  
00537 // Format the date into a string.    
00538 AffxString AffxTime::getDateString(void)
00539 {
00540         AffxString str;
00541 
00542         if (!isEmpty())
00543         {
00544                 int iMonth = getMonth();
00545                 int iDay = getDay();
00546                 int iYear = getYear();
00547 
00548                 char szBuffer[64];
00549                 sprintf(szBuffer, "%d/%d/%d", iMonth, iDay, iYear);
00550                 str = szBuffer;
00551         }
00552 
00553         return str;
00554 }
00555  
00556 // Format the time into a string.    
00557 AffxString AffxTime::getHourMinuteString(void)
00558 {
00559         AffxString str;
00560         char szBuffer[64];
00561         AffxString strAmPm = " AM";
00562 
00563         if (!isEmpty())
00564         {
00565                 int iHour = getHour();
00566                 int iMinute = getMinute();
00567 
00568                 if (iHour >= 12)        //pjo 13-Jan-97 equals sign added
00569                         strAmPm = " PM";
00570                 
00571                 if (iHour >= 13)        //pjo 13-Jan-97 hour adjusted at 1 PM
00572                         iHour -= 12;
00573 
00574                 if (iHour == 0)
00575                         iHour = 12;
00576 
00577                 sprintf(szBuffer, "%d:", iHour);
00578                 str = szBuffer;
00579                 sprintf(szBuffer, "%2d", iMinute);
00580                 if (szBuffer[0] == ' ')
00581                         szBuffer[0] = '0';
00582                 str += szBuffer;
00583                 str += strAmPm;
00584 
00585                 return str;
00586         }
00587 
00588         return str;
00589 }
